instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Hello,
i am working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is not turning on. I fixed the green light (<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. was burned) and now <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> won´t open. In fact it opens for 2-3 seconds (than <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is there and 16V can pass <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> because the Gate is 6.6V) but than the Voltage on the gate jumps to 15.5V and <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> closes. I checked <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> (0,471MOhm), <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> (331KOhm), <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> (5,4Ohm), <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> (15,5Ohm) and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> (15,3Ohm). This should be fine i assume. Now i don´t know what to check next.
Thanks for any help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is 22Ohm. Resistance between Pins 27 and 28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is 25,5Ohm and between Pin 17 and 18 is 18.7Ohms. Pins 16, 17 and 18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> were burned and i need to run jumpers there. As far as i can tell my soldering should be ok because i can not move the jumpers on both sides. So i assume they should be soldered on to the chip. Can this cause the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Yeah, I suspect dead chip or bad soldering there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again and run all the jumpers new. Same as before except that i now get 14,5V on the gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> instead of 15,5V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: I just saw i that i forget to mention that the problem was caused by water damage originally. Sorry for that. Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> is 16,25V and after a few seconds it goes up to 16,53V. I guess that is ok. I thought that <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> should be ok as it is able to switch on and off depending on the gate voltage. But to be sure i exchanged it but still the same behaviour with 15V on the gate. I measured around and also plugged in the battery. With only battery <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> has 9-10V on all pins (my battery could be a bit low) Also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 11V wiht only battery. If i plug charger and Battery in <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> has 6,6V on gate and lets the 16V pass. Also ppbus _g3h is 12,6V if both is plugged in. Is that normal on an older board like this? But if i short pads of <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR> with both plugged in it still wont turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: If the issue is only around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> this board should power on from a charged battery. Connect a battery with charge and see if it can power on. Also check resistance to GND on 3V42 bus and RTC Xtal pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: I tryed a battery with ebought power to start other boards but no sign of life. Resistance to GND on PP3V42 is 0,021V in diode mode. On RTC XTALIN (Pin 1 of Y2810) i get 0,018V and on RTC XTALOUT 0,007V. Also i recognized, that even with battery and charger both plugged in there are no S5 rails and i just get a green, not a orange light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
